intro: Gaylussacia myrtifolia, commonly known as the sweet pepperbush, is a deciduous shrub native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its woody stems and clustered flowers. The plant produces small, white to pinkish flowers in the spring, which are followed by red, fleshy berries in the fall. Its leaves are elliptical, glossy, and have a slightly aromatic scent when crushed. The plant thrives in acidic, well-drained soils and is often found in moist woodlands and streambanks.
